1.text: Also these the proverbs of Solomon which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah transcribed.

2.text: The glory of God to conceal the word: and the glory of kings to search the word.

3.text: The heavens for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings not searched out.

4.text: Take ye away the dross from the silver, and a vessel shall come forth for the goldsmith.

5.text: Take ye away the unjust one from before the king, and his throne shall be prepared in justice.

6.text: Thou shalt not show thyself proud before the king, and thou shalt not stand in the place of the great.

7.text: For good to say to thee, Come up hither, rather than humbling thyself before the noble whom thine eye saw.

8.text: Thou shalt not go forth hastily to strive, lest what thou shalt do in its latter state in thy neighbor putting thee to shame.

9.text: Contend thy contention with thy neighbor; and thou shalt not reveal the secret of another:

10.text: Lest he hearing shall reproach thee, and thine infamy shall not turn away.

11.text: Apples of gold in images of silver is the word spoken upon its wheels.

12.text: An earring of gold and a necklace of gold, the wise one reproving upon the hearing ear.

13.text: As the cold of snow in the day of harvest a faithful messenger to those sending him: he shall restore the soul of his lord.

14.text: Clouds and wind and not rain, a man boasting in a gift of falsehood.

15.text: In slowness to anger shall the prince be persuaded, and the soft tongue shall break the bones.

16.text: Thou didst find honey; eat thy sufficiency, lest thou shalt be satiated, and thou vomit it forth.

17.text: Make rare thy foot from thy neighborâ€™s house, lest he shall be satiated with thee, and hate thee.

18.text: A mallet and a sword and an arrow sharpened, the man answering against his neighbor testimony of falsehood.

19.text: A bad tooth and a wavering foot, the confidence of the faithless one in the day of straits.

20.text: He removing a covering in the day of cold, and vinegar upon nitre, and he singing in songs to an evil heart.

21.text: If thine enemy hunger, give him bread to eat; and if he thirst, give him water to drink:

22.text: For thou tookest up coals of fire upon his head, and Jehovah will recompense to thee.

23.text: The north wind will set free the rain, and an angry face, a hidden tongue.

24.text: Good to dwell upon a corner of the roof rather than with a woman of strifes and a house of community.

25.text: Cold waters to the fainting soul, and a good message from a land far off.

26.text: A fountain trampled down, and a fountain corrupted, the just one turned aside before the unjust one.

27.text: To eat much honey is not good: and to seek out their honor, not honor.

28.text: A city being broken down, and not a wall, a man who restrains not to his spirit.
